title: Citi Raises More Than US$1 Million from Typhoon Yolanda Appeal
summary: Manila - One month after Citi launched a worldwide appeal to clients and employees to support the victims of Typhoon Yolanda, the global bank has raised more than US$1 million to aid the relief and rebuilding efforts in Central Philippines.
tag-1: Citi Raises More Than US$1 Million from Typhoon Yolanda Appeal
tag-3: Manila – One month after Citi launched a worldwide appeal to clients and employees to support the victims of Typhoon Yolanda, the global bank has raised more than US$1 million to aid the relief and rebuilding efforts in Central Philippines.
tag-4: Citi has pledged these contributions to long-time community partners Philippine Red Cross, American Red Cross and Gawad Kalinga.
tag-5: In addition, the Citi Foundation announced it is planning to double its annual grant investment in the Philippines for 2014 to more than US$500,000, and direct these expanded resources to longer-term rebuilding and livelihood restoration programs in the affected areas.
tag-6: Typhoon Yolanda made landfall in the Philippines on Friday, November 8, and has since been recorded as the deadliest natural disaster to hit the country. It damaged more than 1 million houses, displaced over 3.5 million people and left many communities in Visayas, the third largest island group in the country, without food and shelter.
tag-7: Citi was one of the first institutions from the international community to pledge support. The Monday after Typhoon Yolanda hit the Philippines, Citi Asia Pacific CEO Stephen Bird led a fund raising campaign for the benefit of the Philippine Red Cross. He also announced a US$250,000 disaster relief grant from the Citi Foundation to the American Red Cross Pacific Typhoon Fund, aiding relief and recovery efforts in the affected communities.
tag-8: "Our thoughts remain with the people of the Philippines and our focus is on supporting those who have lost families and homes," said Bird. "Citi has operated in the Philippines since 1902, and we have a long history of supporting local communities."
tag-9: Citi's ASEAN Equities business responded to the appeal by committing to donate all commissions from equity sales and trading operations in ASEAN on November 13 to the Philippine Red Cross and raised a total of US$500,000.
tag-10: "The pledges of support from Citi employees around the world have been simply overwhelming," said Batara Sianturi, Citi Country Officer for the Philippines. "Colleagues who have worked in the Philippines or have relatives and friends here are deeply concerned and want to help in any way they can. We have mobilized the collection of relief goods, coordinated volunteer efforts and continue to campaign for contributions to aid the ongoing rescue work."
tag-11: "I am honored to see the response from both our company and our people with their donations and volunteerism in the relief efforts and our clients to the ASEAN trading day," said Bird.
tag-13: "We understand that much work lies ahead and we are committed to aid the Philippines in rebuilding initiatives for the affected communities. The Citi Foundation will also invest in strengthening the disaster response and disaster preparedness programs for the benefit of the greater community," said Bird.

tag-16: The Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations.
